data.title: Fixes some issues with forest editor.
data.body:
Fixes a crash when you try to delete things without being in selection mode in the forest editor. Adds a sanity check that everything is properly set up before attempting the delete action.

Also adds a fix to the mesh item tab in the forest editor to correct odd selection behavior that could erroneously cause selection of two items in the list when you only clicked one.

In reference to #1936

data.title: autobillboard size on imposters does not save
data.body:
When you setup autobillboard size in the shape editor for trees like this.
%this.addImposter("32", "6", "0", "0", "128", "1", "0");
The "size" (first number) of the billboard level determines how much buffer zone there is until it pops to the imposters.
So for example if your imposter level is 128 pixel and you have 32 imposter size then it will start to fade at 160 pixel and on 128 pixels it is fully faded out.
It works when you set it up in shape editor and then test it, but the problem is that after you saved it and load another level it no longer works, there will be no fade and they all will just pop instantly.
Even if you set your imposter fade level to something, the imposter detail level will show 0 polys the next time you open your shape, it works though in the game, but it does not show, if you then set your imposter size again and save it will work again, but will be lost when you quit and load the level again.

It does not happen with the defaulttree because that setting is set in the model file using a node called:
"bb__autobillboard25" this will set this setting in the engine directly.
When you set it in the shape editor it will create a yourtreename.cs file that determines extra options on load, the file will be read correctly it seems, because you can see that it sets the imposter size you set in it in the shape editor, but it does not work in the actual game then.

data.title: models don't update in realtime
data.body: If I scale up a .dae in blender and want to place the new object into the world, I have to restart the ingame server. Otherwise I don't see the update to the mesh. I tested v3.9 and 3.10rc2 on ubuntu 16.04. the bug is always the same. Duion also knows a guy who had the same issue on ubuntu.

data.title: Hotfix to re-add the prior static function fix in platformNet
data.body: Hotfix to re-add the prior static function fix for these functions that was accidentally removed.

data.title: added strikeObject lightning feature
data.body:
added new feature strikeObject to lightning.

Now you can throw a lightning to objects  derived from shapebase, like players, Items, AI, etc.

EDIT: typo

data.title: fix warningFlashes() of lightning class
data.body:
This PR fix the warningFlashes() method, that doesn't randomly select the spot to strike, all the lightning bolts will always strike in the same place.

EDIT: typo :D

data.title: Forest editor brushes and itemData bugs
data.body:
There seems to be a bug in the forest editor that appears when you hit after having added a certain amount of items to the forest editor.
After that weird things happen, like it always selects two items from the managedItemData list and when you delete one you also delete the other, in addition to that it adds random items in the brushes file, ok those are not random, but from the other item that gets selected when you select one from the managedItemData and it does not create the one that you selected on double clicking it, but the one that got automatically selected as well, when you select another one.
Here is a video so you can understand whats happening:
http://duion.com/files/temp/bugs/forest_editor_buggared.mp4

I downloaded the 3.10 rc2 version as a blank base, then I added my old levels over it, first copied over that one http://opengameart.org/content/konserian-highlands-set and then copied over that one http://opengameart.org/content/uberpack-1
After that I had my old level packs back in with lots of forest and forest items.
The bug is almost 4 years old now, but I need a solution now, since I don't want to risk running into it again when I will add more trees.

data.title: Adds a check to the record movie call
data.body: Adds a check to the record movie call so that it only happens in Release mode, to avoid crash issues with theora and debug mode. Related to notes on #1894

data.title: SDL Menubar accelerator fix
data.body: Fixes the accelerator keybinds - most specifically the compound ones like Ctrl-Shift-Alt up - so that they behave properly when using SDL. Old code is retained for non-SDL so behavior is consistent across the board.

data.title: Fixes editor handling of menubars when opening/closing.
data.body: Reworks the open/close functions of the gui and world editors so they will properly handle their menubars and toggle between and clean up when closed.

data.title: Cleans up a few cmake options and flags
data.body: Cleans up a few cmake options and flags a most of the alsoft and sdl options as advanced so they're not cluttering up the regular view for no reason

data.title: Fixes some issues with lightning
data.body:
Fixes the debug netevent packing error by keeping the mStart value as it's proper 0-1 range until it gets to the client, using a temporary world-space var for finding strike target objects in the radius.

Also add a checker for if there is a texture or not set for the lighting bolt. If it use, set the stateblock description to support it and set the texture, if not, only utilize the color blend.

data.title: Texture crash
data.body: Fixtures a problem where textures created with GBitmap class that are non square (i.e like 1024x512) have an incorrect mipmap level calculated.

data.title: Cleanup when deactivating light manager instead of reinitializing
data.body:
A minor change which caused some issues in my work with C#.
Basically, instead of cleaning up when the LM deactivates, we re-initialize most things. 
This change implements cleanup instead.

data.title: Lightning is not rendering
data.body:
Lightning objects do not seem to spawn/render any bolts. I have tired dx9  dx11 and openGl.
This was on the current development build as of this posting.

data.title: Call the correct system rename
data.body: Addressing #1913

data.title: Sdl update fix
data.body: 03c2ce46c260852a60731b2311ca1d668760f3a3 appears to have been an incomplete update of SDL 2.0.5 and it broke the build on OS X.

data.title: GUI Editor mouse cursor bug
data.body:
If you had the GUI editor enabled and switch back to the game, the mouse cursor does not disappear like it should, can anyone confirm this?
You can switch back to world editor and then back to the game and the mouse cursor will properly go away, but not directly from the GUI editor.

data.title: String table empty string
data.body: I was going to merge some old changes of mine from the 1.0.1 days for having a global "empty stringtable entry", and realized the engine had since added the functionality, but didn't appear to actually be using it anywhere. This PR is a global find and replace with `StringTable->insert("")` -> `StringTable->EmptyString()`.

data.title: Optionally include a CMake configurations file from the project directory
data.body:
Optionally include a CMake configurations file from the project directory to support configuration changes that don't have to alter the whole engine repo.

Use cases include needing to configure dependencies for project code that are unrelated to Torque3D as a whole.

data.title: Variadic console templates
data.body: Drastically improved the maintainability of the console API stuff. There are still two places with hardcoded array sizes preventing functions and methods of arbitrary arity from being exposed to the console, but code bloat has also been significantly reduced.

data.title: Fixed StaticShape onUnmount
data.body: Somebody made a typo and didn't test if it compiled before committing...

data.title: [Bug] World Editor Screen and GUI goes black.
data.body:
Reproduction for this bug - 
1. Open up the level editor from the main menu.
2. After the World editor fully loads click on the GUI editor button.
3. Click back on the World Editor button to go back to the World editor.
4. World Editor and UI should be black. Example -> http://i.imgur.com/LzF1GGh.png

Version of T3D: 3.10 RC2

System Specs - 

CPU: AMD 6100 FX 3.0 GHz
GPU: AMD R7 265 2GB
Ram: 16GB

If you need more info please let me know.

data.title: [Feature Request] Large world support
data.body:
Would it be possible to get large world support in the main branch of T3D?

Here is what I mean by that - 
1. Terrain paging via [Terrain Master](https://github.com/ChrisCalef/T3DTerrainMaster)
2. Some form of large world coordinate system to avoid floating point issues. I know that [game programming gems 4](http://www.aiwisdom.com/resource_gpg4.html) has some form of Large world coordinate system in it. It should be a good starting point.

data.title: SFX Variance Overflow
data.body: The compiler warned that `mVariance[1]` was out of bounds. This should have been varying the index along the second axis of mVariance, and keeping the first axis fixed at 0. The compiler didn't catch that there was also a type error, because `Con::printf` isn't typesafe.

data.title: Fixed semaphore struct to class
data.body: platformSDL had `PlatformSemaphore` defined as a struct rather than a class, which conflicted with the original declaration.

data.title: Explicit self-assignments in render management.
PosixFileSystem::rename infinitely recurses
